completed_tasks.title: Review Strike 2: Verify no lint errors exist in the codebase
completed_tasks.description:
Perform a comprehensive code review with focus on: Verify no lint errors exist in the codebase

Check the entire codebase and ensure this criterion is met.

## CRITICAL FAILURE RESPONSE PROTOCOL

IF LINT ERRORS FOUND: Create specific TASK CREATION tasks in TODO.json to achieve zero lint errors:
- Linting tool setup and configuration tasks
- Code style correction tasks
- Import organization tasks
- Naming convention fixes tasks
- Dead code removal tasks

CRITICAL: Use TaskManager API to add these tasks immediately when lint errors are detected.

## SUCCESS CRITERIA
- Mark this review task as completed ONLY if the criterion is fully met
- If criterion fails, you MUST create remediation tasks using TaskManager API before marking review as completed
- All new tasks should be actionable, specific, and include proper dependencies/important_files parameters

## TASK CREATION REQUIREMENT
When creating remediation tasks, ensure each task includes:
- Clear success criteria
- Appropriate mode (DEVELOPMENT/TESTING/REFACTORING)
- Specific file dependencies
- Realistic time estimates
- High priority for critical issues

Use the task-creation.md guidelines for optimal task structure.

Check the entire codebase and ensure this criterion is met.

IF BUILD FAILS: Create specific TASK CREATION tasks in TODO.json to fix build issues:
- Missing dependencies installation tasks
- Build configuration setup tasks  
- Compilation error resolution tasks
- Environment setup tasks
- Build script creation tasks

CRITICAL: Use TaskManager API to add these tasks immediately when build failures are detected.

- If criterion fails, you MUST create remediation tasks using TaskManager API before marking review as completed

- Clear success criteria
- Appropriate mode (DEVELOPMENT/TESTING/REFACTORING)

completed_tasks.title: COMPREHENSIVE PUPPETEER TESTING - ABSOLUTE PERFECTION MANDATE

ULTIMATE TESTING MANDATE - TOP PRIORITY

**ABSOLUTE REQUIREMENTS:**
- Use Puppeteer with persistent single tab on single browser
- Open EVERY page, click EVERY button, use EVERY feature
- Take multiple screenshots before/after EVERY action
- Capture console logs before/after EVERY action
- Include realistic pauses between interactions to simulate authentic user behavior
- Test systematically: every clickable element, button, link, form field, dropdown, checkbox, radio button
- Use existing Puppeteer tests as foundation if available

**ERROR PROTOCOL:**
- If ANY errors found during testing  Create new tasks with HIGHER PRIORITY to fix immediately
- Testing becomes PRIMARY FOCUS until perfection achieved

**PERFECTION STANDARD:**
- ONLY ABSOLUTE COMPLETION PERFECTION ACCEPTED
- Everything must work flawlessly
- Must look professional with unified color scheme
- All features must be fully functional

**EVIDENCE REQUIREMENTS:**
- Screenshot documentation at every major step
- Console log collection for all interactions
- Comprehensive test coverage of all features
- System reliability assessment

**PRIORITY:** This is the MAIN AND ONLY FOCUS from here on out

completed_tasks.title: Implement phases system EXCLUSIVELY for FEATURE TASKS ONLY
completed_tasks.description:
Add phase tracking EXCLUSIVELY to FEATURE TASKS ONLY with sequential numbering (Phase 1, Phase 2, etc.) to help with timeline management and project organization.

 CRITICAL REQUIREMENT: Phases are ONLY for feature tasks - NOT for error, subtask, or test tasks.

Implementation Requirements:
1. Add phases field to FEATURE objects ONLY in TODO.json structure
2. Update TaskManager API to support phase creation/management for FEATURE TASKS ONLY
3. Add phase progression logic (Phase 1  Phase 2  Phase 3) for FEATURE TASKS ONLY
4. Update API endpoints to handle phase queries/updates for FEATURE TASKS ONLY
5. Add phase validation and timeline tracking for FEATURE TASKS ONLY
6. Update ALL documentation and guides:
   - taskmanager-api.js internal guide system
   - docs/ directory documentation files
   - API reference documentation
   - User guides and examples
   - Troubleshooting guides
   - Update guide responses to include phase system info

Phases: Simple numbering (Phase 1, Phase 2, Phase 3, etc.)
Purpose: Track FEATURE development timeline and phase dependencies

EXCLUSIVE SCOPE: Error tasks, subtask tasks, and test tasks should NEVER have phases - phases are FEATURE-ONLY functionality.
